--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "dfabulich" <dan@...> wrote:
>
> There's a pr=
etty standard format for JUnit XML output.  You've
> probably seen it: ther=
e's a <testsuite> root element containing
> zero-or-more <testcase> element=
s, each of which may contain a
> <failure> or <error> element.  (There's al=
so a <properties> element
> with zero-or-more <property> elements.)  A lot =
of tools know how to
> read this format and report on it, including at leas=
t Ant, Maven,
> Cruise Control, Hudson, Bamboo, Eclipse and IntelliJ IDEA.
=
> 

I think the XML result format is owned (-in the open source meaning of =

the word-) by Ant.
They started generating the XML result files in the JUn=
it task, and the 
consolidated XML result file in the JUnitReport task.

> =

> -Dan
>

Regards, Jan
